data.text: Then Eliphaz, from Teman, replied to Job. He said,
“Will you please let me say something to you?
In the past, you have instructed/taught many people,
By what you said, you have helped those who ◄needed spiritual help/almost quit trusting in God► [MET],
But now, when you experience disasters, you become discouraged.
You revere God; ◄does that not cause you to trust in him?/that should cause you to trust in him.► [RHQ]
Think about this: Do innocent people die while they are still young [RHQ]?
What I have experienced is this: Just as [MET] farmers who plant bad seeds do not harvest good crops,
They die when God angrily blows his breath on them,
Even though wicked people may be very powerful like young lions,
They will die like fierce lions that starve to death when there are no animals that they can kill and eat,
“I heard a message that someone came
He spoke to me at night when I was having a bad dream that disturbed/frightened me
It caused me to be afraid and tremble;
A ghost glided past my face
It stopped, but I could not see what form it had.
‘◄Does God consider anyone to be righteous?/No human beings can be righteous in God’s sight!► [RHQ]
God cannot be sure that his own angels will always do what is right;
So he certainly cannot trust human beings who were made from dust and clay,
People are sometimes well in the morning, but in the evening they are dead.
They are like [MET] tents that collapse suddenly:
